Enhancing business automation with integration
300-level live demo

 ); ![banner](./images/banner-prep.jpg) | DEMO OVERVIEW | | | :--- | :--- | | **Scenario overview** | This demo shows how the IBM Cloud Pak for Business Automation and the IBM Cloud Pak for Integration can be combined to streamline a customer account opening process. To illustrate this combination, application integration is added to an existing workflow implementation. | | **Demo products** | Cloud Pak for Business Automation (CP4BA); Cloud Pak for Integration (CP4I) | | **Demo capabilities** | Workflow (Cloud Pak for Business Automation); Application integration (Cloud Pak for Integration) | | **Demo intro slides** | Download the Introduction and Overview slides here. This is a short deck of customer-facing slides that sets the context for the demo. | | **Demo script** | A complete demo script is on the second tab above. You can download a printer-ready PDF of the demo script here.

This demo script has multiple tasks that each have multiple steps. In each step, you have the details about what you need to do (**Actions**), what you can say while delivering this demo step (**Narration**), and what diagrams and screenshots you will see.

This demo script is a suggestion, and you are welcome to customize based on your sales opportunity. Most importantly, practice this demo in advance. If the demo seems easy for you to execute, the customer will focus on the content. If it seems difficult for you to execute, the customer will focus on your delivery. | | ** Sales enablement video** | View the enablement video here. This video is for enablement purposes only (IBMers and Business Partners) and is not customer-ready. | | **How to get support** | **For IBMers:**
• Contact #itz-techzone-support or techzone.help@ibm.com regarding issues with reserving and provisioning Tech Zone environments.
• Contact #platinumdemos-automation-support regarding issues with setting up and running this demo.

**For Business Partners:**
• Contact Tech Zone Support regarding issues with reserving and provisioning Tech Zone environments.
• Contact Automation Platinum Demos Support regarding issues with setting up and running this demo. | ## **INSTALL THE DEMO: Cloud Pak for Integration (ROKS)**
1 - Provision Red Hat OpenShift on IBM Cloud for Cloud Pak for Integration
Provision Red Hat OpenShift on IBM Cloud (ROKS) ready to install the Cloud Pak for Integration. To provision your ROKS instance, follow these steps:
1. To provision a ROKS cluster, go here and complete the form.
2. You will receive a confirmation email confirming the instance is provisioning.
3. You will receive a second email once the environment is provisioned. You should expect this to take between 30 and 120 minutes. This email contains information, such as URLs, allowing you to connect to the instance.

**[Go to top](#top)**
2 - Install the Cloud Pak for Integration on ROKS
1. Click the **Cluster URL** from the environment confirmation email. Log into IBM Cloud using your IBMid.

2. After you are logged in, click here to install Cloud Pak for Integration.

Make sure you are in an **ITZ** account (1) and the **Product version** is **2022.2.1** (2).

3. Scroll down to the **Select your cluster** section. From the list, select the **Red Hat OpenShift Cluster** (1) that you just created and click **Add project** (2).

4. Enter '**cp4i**' as the **Project** name. Click **Add**.
5. Scroll down to the **Set the deployment values** section and toggle the **Use an existing secret?** slider to **No** (1). Enter a value for **csDefaultAdminPassword** (2). It is important that you choose a password that is 32 characters in length and is composed of only letters and numbers. You will need this password in step 12.
Password validation is currently not enforced on this page. If you proceed with an invalid password, you will be able to start the installation, but it will fail. There is no way to recover from this error other than provisioning a new cluster.

6. Scroll down to **Optional deployment values**. Click the collapsible section to open them. First, we will select the appropriate parameters for this specific demo:

1. **cognitiveCarRepairDemo**: Set to ‘**true**’
2. **drivewayDentDeletionDemo**: Set to ‘**false**’
3. **eventEnabledInsuranceDemo**: Set to ‘**false**’
4. **mappingAssistDemo**: Set to ‘**false**’
5. **weatherChatbotDemo**: Set to ‘**false**’

7. Continue to change the parameters and values:
If you don’t have an SMTP email server and accounts that you can use, you may sign up for a free Mailtrap.io account. Mailtrap.io is a free cloud service that mimics an SMTP server. It is used for development/demonstration purposes only.
1. demoAPICMailServerHost: If you’re using mailtrap, leave this as 'smtp.mailtrap.io.'
2. demoAPICMailServerPort: If you’re using mailtrap, leave this as '2525.'
3. demoAPICEmailAddress: If you’re using mailtrap, you can use any email address. The dummy address ’apicadmin@example.com’ is recommended. If you’re using your own mail server, use an email address that you can receive and read.
4. demoAPICMialServerUsername: Set this to your SMTP mailtrap username. This is different from your mailtrap login username and can be found by using these instructions.
5. demoAPICMailServerPassword: Set this to your SMTP mailtrap password. This is different from your mailtrap login password and can be found by using these instructions.


8. Accept the license agreement (1) and click **Install** (2) to install Cloud Pak for Integration. The installation will take up to 150 minutes.

9. You can view the progress in the Schematics progress bar (1), or check the details by clicking **View log** (2).

10. When the status is **Active**, you will be able to access Cloud Pak for Integration Platform Navigator. Select **Offering Dashboard** on the upper right corner of the page.

11. On the login page, select the **IBM provided credentials (admin only)** authentication type.

12. Use the admin username and password (1) you created in step 5, and click **Log in** (2).

13. Click **Integration instances**.

You have successfully completed cluster provisioning, installation of Cloud Pak for Integration, and deployment of API Connect and App Connect. You are ready to proceed.
**[Go to top](#top)**
3 - Prerequisites and preparing your Cloud Pak for Integration environment
**Deploy IBM MQ**
In this section, you will access your ROKS cluster and install IBM MQ configured ready for App Connect.
1. Open My reservations in **IBM Technology Zone**.
2. Select your **CP4I ROKS** cluster.

3. Click **Open your IBM Cloud environment**.

4. Click **OpenShift web console**.

5. On the web console, click the **+** icon (1), copy the content of this file (externalqmgr.yaml) into the screen (2), and click **Create** (3).

**Connect Cloud Pak for Integration to your endpoints**
Now, let's configure our services endpoints in Cloud Pak for Integration.
1. In the menu on the top left, open the **Design** folder (1) and select **Integrations** (2).

2. Click the **Catalog** icon to see a list of the available connectors.

3. To configure the MQ connection, search for '**IBM MQ**' (1) and click **Connect** (2).

4. Click **Continue**.

5. Enter '**basicmq**' for the **Queue manager name** (1), '**basicmq-ibm-mq**' for the **Queue manager hostname** (2), and '**1414**' for the **Listener port number** (3).

6. Enter '**SYSTEM.DEF.SVRCONN**' for the **Channel name** (1), and click **Connect** (2).

7. Click **Continue**.

8. Click the **APIs** tab (1) and then the **+** icon (2).

9. Download the API definition for the external account service from here.
10. Select the downloaded **CustomerAccountOpenAPIJSONServer.yaml** file (1), and click **Next** (2).

11. Click **Add API**.

12. Expand the imported API (1), and click **Connect** (2).

13. Scroll down and click **Connect**.
**Import the flows**
1. Download the following two files:
• MQ flow to simulate the acquired bank
• Accounts API flow that workflow will use
2. Import each downloaded file by clicking the **Dashboard** icon (1), **New** (2), and then **Import flow…** (3).

3. Add the downloaded **MQExternalProvider.yaml** file (1), and click **Import** (2).

4. Start the imported flow by selecting the menu at the top right (1) and clicking **Start flow** (2).

5. Repeat the process for the other downloaded **Accounts.yaml** file. This time, the flow is started by switching the toggle from **Stopped** to **Started**.

**Test the flow**
1. Click the **Dashboard** icon to return to the dashboard and view the imported flows.

2. Select the **Accounts** flow.

3. Select the **Test** tab (1), **Get /Accounts/{customerId}** operation (2), and then the **Try it** tab (3).

4. Scroll down and enter '**1234567890**' in the **customerId** field (1), and click **Send** (2).

5. The first test will fail due to a known timeout issue with the error shown in the screenshot below. Click **Send** a second time to receive the correct response.

6. You will see the following correct response.

7. Three environmentally specific pieces of information are required to integrate the API into the workflow: the API URL, client ID and hostname.

Scroll to the top of the screen and save the **API URL** (1) and **client ID** (2).

The hostname is contained within the API URL. It is the portion between "http://" and the next "/".

Then the hostname is: ademo-gw-gateway-cp4i.itzroks-120000k3ak-vzlud5-4b4a324f027aea19c5cbc0c3275c4656-0000.eu-de.containers.appdomain.cloud

Copy and save the hostname with the API URL and client ID.
**[Go to top](#top)**
## **INSTALL THE DEMO: Cloud Pak for Business Automation (Windows VM)**
1 - Provision a Technology Zone demo environment
1. Reserve a Technology Zone demo environment here.
2. Wait until your reservation status is **Ready** on the IBM Technology Zone’s **My Library → My Reservations** page. (You can either keep refreshing the My Reservation page or wait for a confirmation email.)

When your reservation is **Ready**, click the reservation tile to view the reservation details.

3. On the reservation details page, copy or bookmark the **Published services** links for **BAW Workflow Center** and **BAW Process Portal**.

When your reservation is **Ready**, click the reservation tile to view the reservation details.

**[Go to top](#top)**
2 - Import the signer certificate for Cloud Pak for Integration
1. From the reservation details page, scroll down and click to open the BAW Remote Console. It is the link on the left.

2. The console will open. Click **Full screen.**

3. Click **Yes** on the **Networks** dialog box.
The first time you access the VM, you will be presented with the network option below. It is imperative to select YES. (Otherwise, the VM will not be properly configured for this demo.)

4. On the Windows desktop, double-click the **WebSphere Console** shortcut to open the WebSphere Console.

5. Click **Advanced…**, then **Accept the Risk and Continue** to continue past the security warning.
6. Enter '**admin**' as the **User ID** and '**admin**' as the **Password**.

7. Open **Security** (1) and click **SSL certificate and key management** (2).

8. Click **Key stores and certificates**.

9. Click **CellDefaultTrustStore**.

10. Click **Signer certificates**.

11. Click **Retrieve from port**.

12. For **Host**, enter your Cloud Pak for Integration ROKS hostname. For **Port**, enter '**443**'. For **Alias**, enter '**integration-1**'. Click **Retrieve signer information**.

13. Click **Apply**.

14. Click **Save**.

15. The new certificate is now added.

You can now close the BAW VM console window.
**[Go to top](#top)**
4 - Import the process app and update the 'AccountsServer' hostname in the process app settings
1. Using a browser on your local computer, open **BAW Workflow Center** using the Published Services link from the top of the Technology Zone reservation page.
2. Click **Process Apps**.

3. Click **Import**.

4. Click **Browse**.

5. Select the **New_Account_Opening.twx** file (1). Click **Open** (2).

6. Click **OK**.

7. Wait for the import to complete. Click **New Account Opening**.

8. Click the **Servers** tab.

9. In **Process App Settings**, **AccountsServer** must be updated with the hostname of your Cloud Pak for Integration ROKS environment. Set **Hostname** to the hostname of your Cloud Pak for Integration ROKS environment.

**[Go to top](#top)**
## **PREPARE TO GIVE THE DEMO**
1 - Log into Cloud Pak for Integration
1. Open **Cloud Pak for Integration** and click **IBM provided credentials (admin only)**.

2. Enter your admin username and password (1), and click **Log in** (2).

3. Click **Integration instances**.

4. On the **Integration instances** page, click **ace-designer-demo**.
**[Go to top](#top)**
2 - Open the account opening process in Process Designer
1. Using Firefox on your local computer, open **BAW Workflow Center** using the Published Services link from the top of the Technology Zone reservation page.
Using separate browsers for Process Designer vs. Process Portal prevents the logins from colliding with each other.
2. Log in to **Workflow Center** using '**admin**' as both the **User name** and **Password**.

3. Click **Process Apps**.

4. Click **New Account Opening**.

5. Click **Processes** (1) and then **New Account (Current Workflow)** (2).

6. The **New Account (Current Workflow)** process definition is now open.

**[Go to top](#top)**
3 - Log into Process Portal
1. Using Chrome on your local computer, open **BAW Process Portal** using the Published Services link from the top of the Technology Zone reservation page.
Using separate browsers for Process Designer vs. Process Portal prevents the logins from colliding with each other.
2. Log in with '**assistant**' as the **Username** and '**passw0rd**' as the **Password**.

3. **Process Portal** is now open.

**[Go to top](#top)**
4 - Have the API key handy
The very last step of the Cloud Pak for Integration installation (above) required you to save the API key.
In the demo script, you will be required to enter the Cloud Pak for Integration API key into the process application. Make sure the API key is easily accessible.
For easy access, store the API key in the Windows clipboard.
**[Go to top](#top)**
5 - Have the YAML file handy
In the demo script, you will be required to use the OpenAPI 3.0 YAML file to discover the API. Download the YAML file **here**.
**[Go to top](#top)**
*** Click [here](/300-enhancing-ba-with-integration/demo-script) to go to the **Demo script** on the next tab.
